thread.title: Tottenham boss Mauricio Pochettino and Christian Eriksen have different opinions on Europa League defeat to minnows Gent
thread.title_full: Tottenham boss Mauricio Pochettino and Christian Eriksen have different opinions on Europa League defeat to minnows Gent

author: achapman
title: Tottenham boss Mauricio Pochettino and Christian Eriksen have different opinions on Europa League defeat to minnows Gent
text:
'We were stupid' Tottenham boss Mauricio Pochettino and Christian Eriksen have different opinions on Europa League defeat to minnows Gent 
Spurs crash out of Europa League with tails between their legs in shambolic repeat of Champions League campaign By ANTHONY CHAPMAN CHRISTIAN ERIKSEN has blasted Tottenham for failing to take their chances against Gent this evening. 
Spurs trailed the Belgian minnows 1-0 from their Europa League first-leg clash. Reuters 7 Christian Eriksen has criticised Tottenham after they crashed out of the Europa League 
But the north Londoners failed to take advantage of their huge home support at Wembley as Gent secured a 2-2 draw to go through 3-2 on aggregate. Keep up to date with ALL the Tottenham news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Dele Alli was shown the first red card of his professional career as Tottenham totally dominated their opponents on the pitch. 
But Mauricio Pochettino’s men were eventually sent packing with their tails between their legs after also crashing out of the Champions League late last year. 
And Eriksen feels Spurs have only themselves to blame for another poor continental showing after seeing league rivals Manchester United cruise into the last 16 last night. Getty Images Gent were delighted to book their place in the quarter finals at Wembley Sunday Premier League match preview including Tottenham v Stoke Reuters 7 Dele Alli was shown the first red card of his professional career 
He said: “We are disappointed with what we achieved across the two games. They did not even have a shot on target in the first half but they got a goal which made it more difficult. 
“We then gave it away on a stupid mistake again, they took it very well. We weren’t good enough in our finishing and final passing. Related Stories EUROPA LIVE Tottenham 2 Gent 2 (2-3 agg): Ten-man Spurs concede late on to leave them on the brink of crashing out of Europa League with just minutes to go 'Disgusting' Dele Alli blasted by BT pundits for his 'career-ending' tackle which saw Spurs star shown straight red card before crashing out of Europe Spurs At Wembley Why are Tottenham playing at Wembley in Europe and how long will they stay there? PREM FIXTURES Chelsea look to extend lead at the top of the table to 11 points against Swansea Getty Images Harry Kane also appeared to be in disbelief at the final whistle AP:Associated Press 7 Eriksen feels Spurs did not take their chances and only have themselves to blame 
“Overall we did what we could, the ref wasn’t on our side. I haven’t seen if [Dele Alli’s sending off] is a red card. 
“We showed good character with ten men, we are very disappointed. We can’t blame the ref, it’s our own fault. We had our chances, we weren’t good enough.” Getty Images Gent join the likes of Manchester United in the next stage of the Europa League PA:Press Association 7 Mauricio Pochettino insists he is proud of United's performance with ten men 
However, boss Pochettino insists he is ‘proud’ of his players following a spirited performance while down to ten men. 
He added: “We were excited to play today in front of our fans. I am very proud because with ten we make chances. We played with very good energy.”
